cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest, then northwest, toward the middle Texas coast where it is forecast to slow, stall and meander through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Rockport area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch from San Luis Pass to High Island (just southwest of Port Arthur)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from Matagorda to High Island, TX (includes Port Arthur area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire upper and middle Texas coast from Corpus Christi through Galveston Bay to Port Arthur and the southwest Louisiana border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely; low (≤4%) chance of sustained 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible around Sabine Pass and the Port Arthur waterfront, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches of rain with isolated totals near 30 inches could cause life-threatening freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged coastal flooding, dangerous surf and rip currents, and isolated tornadoes in feeder bands.
